result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Anthony Gruer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond Anthony Gruer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond Anthony Gruer was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:59 p.m.  Defendant Raymond Anthony Gruer in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Defendant Raymond Anthony Gruer in custody.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie addresses the court regarding sentencing.  Recommends 6 months jail based on prior convictions.  Mangelsen addresses the court regarding sentencing.  Defendant has been accepted into MN Teen Challenge Program.  Also would be accepted into Life Renewal Program with an order signed by the Court.  Mangelsen asking for time served.  Defendant addresses Court regarding sentencing.  Court addresses Defendant regarding sentencing.  Court orders 6 months Pierce County Jail, 90 days credit. September 21, 2017 release date. Civil judgment in the amount of $518.00.   Appeal rights are given to defendant.  2:13 p.m.
Heidi Mangelson
from Probation and Parole Agent S Drazkowski re: recommending 4-6 months jail and will not be attending the hearing.
Defendant's JOC's. RETURN TO SENDER

Defendant Raymond Anthony Gruer in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court via phone. 15CF260 heard at this time.  Defendant has copy of complaints.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich: $3000 on each file. Nelson has no objection. Def has not been in the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
